div.p: Reading from home on a device is fun! Below are some great options for books, and there are even books that will read aloud!

Ponca City Public Library
You can sign up online and get access to the E-Books for children (and teens and adults!).
Sign Up HERE

MyOn --> https://www.myon.com/school/mccordreads
username = read
password = books

Amazon Audible for Kids is offering free E-Books for read aloud during the school closure.
https://stories.audible.com/start-listen
Many books are AR books! Download the free app called "Bookscanner" to find out. Scan the barcode and the test number will pop up, along with how many points the book is worth.

a.aria-label: Read more about E-Books for Kids

div.p: Every year, school districts receive an "A-F Report Card" from the state of Oklahoma. I am very proud of our staff and students, who have worked hard during the school year to improve our score. I also want to thank you, our parents, for placing a priority on student learning and attendance.

We are scored in three areas: Academic Performance, Academic Growth, and Attendance. As you can see, McCord out-performed the state in all areas. You can see the scores for your student and for the school at https://www.oklaschools.com/, or for your convenience I have them below.

a.aria-label: Read more about 2018-2019 A-F Report Card

h3.a: You Can Make Online Payments Now!

p.style: margin-top:.7pt; margin-right:-1.0pt; margin-bottom:.0001pt; margin-left:84.1pt; text-align:center; margin:0in 0in 10pt

span.span: McCord is excited to offer MySchoolBucks® School Store! This online payment service provides an easy way to pay for items such as After School Care, Breakfast and/or Lunch, Field Trips, or Class Fees using your credit/debit card or electronic check. You may still pay by cash or check at the office, but credit/debit card payments will no longer be available through the office.

span.b: MySchoolBucks is convenient, secure, and efficient.
If you don’t have an account follow the steps below:

span.span: Go to www.MySchoolBucks.com and register for a free account.
Add your students using their school name and student ID. You can get the student ID from the Parent Portal where you check grades.
Make purchases with your credit/debit card or electronic check. There is a 3.95% program fee for using your credit/debit card. For example, a $50 payment will have a program fee of $1.98.

span.i: You will have the opportunity to review any fees and cancel if you choose, before you are charged.

span.span: If you have any questions, contact MySchoolBucks directly:

a.aria-label: Read more about You Can Make Online Payments Now!

div.p: Rise & Shine Assemblies are scheduled for the 2019-2020 school year. If dates need to change, we will alert the community as soon as possible. Until construction is complete, assemblies will be held in the gym at 8:20. Each Rise & Shine Assembly is hosted by a grade level and will present the word for the upcoming month.
September 20: featuring the 6th grade. Word for October is Initiative: Doing what is right before I'm told.
October 25: featuring 5th grade. Word for November is Gratitude: Being thankful for and appreciating what you have and those around you.
November 22: featuring 4th grade. Word for December is Giving: Caring about others more than yourself.
December 13: featuring 3rd grade. Word for January is Obedience: Cheerfully following the directions and wishes of my authorities.
January 31: featuring 2nd grade. Word for February is Self-Control: Stop, Think or Pray, and Do what is right!
February 28: featuring 1st grade. Word for March is Responsibility: Knowing and doing what is expected of me.
March 27: featuring Kindergarten. Word for April is Perseverence: Keep trying when something is difficult; Don't give up!
April 17: featuring PreK. Word is Kindness: Caring about others and showing respect.

a.aria-label: Read more about Rise & Shine Assemblies for 2019-2020

span.span: Welcome to McCord Public School District web site. The site will continue to evolve and keep you up to date on important school activities and information. While the site won't be a daily newspaper by any means, it is certainly our goal to keep the content fresh and exciting in an effort to entice you to return often.

br.font: Download our app! Android and iOS availability. Be sure to enable notifications so we can push important info to you.

p.span: The next time you view our website on a tablet or smartphone, our web site will automatically detect your mobile device, display the mobile view and will remember it each time you return. If you change your mind, look for the Full Site/Mobile link on the footer of the web site to toggle back and forth.

img.br: In addition to view choices, the mobile view offers additional features. You can learn about them and some interesting facts about mobile access by clicking here.

span.span: e sure to visit the calendar component of the web site. Sign up for weekly or monthly reminders for the events and activities you are interested in. Click
for more details, including instructions for clipping events.
So, take a look now, and then keep checking in with us from time to time; hopefully you'll notice the changes, the new features, etc. Thanks for visiting and come back again soon.

a.aria-label: Read more about Welcome to www.mccordschool.net
